column4: description
Study Design Descriptors

A term allowing the classification of the study based on the overall experimental design (e.g. crossover design; parallel group design). The term can be free text or from, for example, a controlled  vocabulary or an ontology. If the latter source is used the Term Accession Number and Term Source  REF fields below are required.
If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. The accession number from the Term Source associated with the selected term

If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. Identifies the controlled vocabulary or ontology that this term comes from. The Source REF has to match one of the Term Source Name declared in the ontology
Study Factor(s)

The name of one factor used in the Study and/or Assay files. A factor corresponds to an independent  variable manipulated by the experimentalist with the intention to affect biological systems in a way  that can be measured by an assay.

A term allowing the classification of this factor into categories. The term can be free text or from, for  example, a controlled vocabulary or an ontology. If the latter source is used the Term Accession  Number and Term Source REF fields below are required.
If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. The accession number from the Term Source associated with the selected term

If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. Identifies the controlled vocabulary or ontology that this term comes from. The Source REF has to match one of the Term Source Name declared in the ontology
Declares and describes each Assay file associated with the current Study.

A term to qualify the endpoint, or what is being measured (e.g. gene expression profiling; protein identification). The term can be free text or from, for example, a controlled vocabulary or an ontology.  If the latter source is used the Term Accession Number and Term Source REF fields below are  required.
If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. The accession number from the Term Source associated with the selected term

If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. Identifies the controlled vocabulary or ontology that this term comes from. The Source REF has to match one of the Term Source Name declared in the ontology

Term to identify the technology used to perform the measurement, e.g. DNA microarray, mass  spectrometry. The term can be free text or from, for example, a controlled vocabulary or an ontology.  If the latter source is used the Term Accession Number and Term Source REF fields below are  required.
If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. The accession number from the Term Source associated with the selected term

If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. Identifies the controlled vocabulary or ontology that this term comes from. The Source REF has to match one of the Term Source Name declared in the ontology
Manufacturer and platform name (e.g., Bruker AVANCE).
A field to specify the name of the Assay file corresponding the definition of that assay.
Study Protocols

The name(s) of the protocols used in the experimental sequence. The protocol names are used as identifiers within the document and will be referenced in the Study Protocol REF columns. Names may be local identifiers, fully qualified external accession numbers or DOIs.

Term to classify the protocol. The term can be free text or from, for example, a controlled vocabulary  or an ontology. If the latter source is used the Term Accession Number and Term Source REF fields  below are required.
If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. The accession number from the Term Source associated with the selected term

If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. Identifies the controlled vocabulary or ontology that this term comes from. The Source REF has to match one of the Term Source Name declared in the ontology
A free-text description of the protocol.
Pointer to protocol resources external to the ISA-TAB that can be accessed by their Uniform  Resource Identifier (URI).
An identifier for the version of the protocol used to ensure adequate protocol tracking.

If a controlled vocabulary or an ontology is used this field is required. The accession number from the Term Source associated with the selected term
